snippet: How can A-Rod’s deal be the worst when, within the same city, Amar’e Stoudemire appears to be having a more deleterious effect on the Knicks’ ability to sniff championship contention?
abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column contends that multimillion dollar contract of New York Knicks forward Amar'e Stoudemire is actually worse for his team than mega-contract of New York Yankees aging third baseman Alex Rodriguez; notes that nobody forced either franchise to commit to these now-regrettable deals.
lead_paragraph: How can A-Rod’s deal be the worst when, within the same city, Amar’e Stoudemire appears to be having a more deleterious effect on the Knicks’ ability to sniff championship contention?

headline.seo: Whose Contract Is Worse? Amar’e Stoudemire’s or Alex Rodriguez’s?
headline.main: Hard to Tell Whose Contract Is Worse
